<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=70,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=955840,FOLIO='61',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]CM49601A.;97',USER='CHE108234',CD='10-MAR-2016;05:01' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_CM49601_1_62">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_CAPITALIZATION>
<EFX_DILUTION>
<A NAME="FIS_DILUTION"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_CM49601_DILUTION">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_TOC_CM49601_4">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DILUTION
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If you invest in our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, your interest will be diluted to the extent of the difference between the initial
	public offering price per share of our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock and the pro forma net tangible book value per share of our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock after this Offering. Dilution results from the
	fact that the per share offering price of the Class&nbsp;A Common Stock is substantially in excess of the pro forma net tangible book value per share of our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock after this
	Offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The pro forma net tangible book value of Red Rock as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million or
	$&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;per share of Class&nbsp;A Common
	Stock. Pro forma net tangible book value represents the amount of total tangible assets less total liabilities, and pro forma net tangible book value per share of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock
	represents pro forma net tangible book value divided by the number of shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock outstanding, in each case, after giving effect to the Offering and Reorganization
	Transactions described under "The Reorganization of Our Corporate Structure" and the effect of the transfer of certain assets and repayment of certain liabilities of Fertitta Entertainment not
	included in the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition assuming that all of the holders of&nbsp;LLC Units (other than Red
	Rock) exchanged their&nbsp;LLC Units, together with all outstanding shares of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock, for shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock on a one-for-one basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;After giving effect to the sale of the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock in this Offering, at an assumed initial public offering
	price of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;per share
	(the midpoint of the range set forth on the cover page of this prospectus), the receipt and application of the net proceeds as described under "Use of Proceeds" and after giving effect to the Offering
	and Reorganization Transactions and the effect of the transfer of certain assets and repayment of certain liabilities of Fertitta Entertainment not included in the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition,
	Red Rock's as adjusted pro forma net tangible book value as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million or
	$&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;per share of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock
	assuming that all of the holders of&nbsp;LLC Units (other than Red Rock) exchanged their&nbsp;LLC Units, together with all outstanding shares of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock, for shares of
	Class&nbsp;A Common Stock on a one-for-one basis. The following table illustrates this per share dilution assuming the underwriters do not exercise their option to purchase additional shares:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_18"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reflects&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;outstanding
	shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, consisting of (i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;outstanding shares of Class&nbsp;A
	Class&nbsp;A Common Stock issued in connection with the Blocker Mergers, (ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;outstanding shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock issued in substitution for profit units issued
	by Station Holdco to current or former employees of the Company and (iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;outstanding shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock issuable upon the exchange of&nbsp;LLC Units and
	corresponding shares of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock to be held by existing owners immediately prior to this Offering.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=71,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=156833,FOLIO='62',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]CM49601A.;97',USER='CHE108234',CD='10-MAR-2016;05:01' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_CM49601_1_63">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Pro
	forma stockholders' equity reflects a partial increase of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million as a result of the issuance of our Class&nbsp;A Common
	Stock, offset by a reduction of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million related to our purchase of&nbsp;LLC units from our existing owners. Pro forma stockholders' equity also reflects a reduction of
	$&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million related to the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition. The cash payments for the purchase of&nbsp;LLC units from our existing owners and the Fertitta Entertainment
	Acquisition are accounted for as equity distributions to our existing owners because Station Holdco and Fertitta Entertainment are entities under common control.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_19"></A>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reflects&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;outstanding
	shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, consisting of (i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock
	to be issued in this Offering and (ii)&nbsp;the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shares described in note&nbsp;(1) above less the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shares of
	Class&nbsp;A Common Stock issuable upon the exchange
	of&nbsp;LLC Units and corresponding shares of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock to be purchased from certain of our existing owners using a portion of the net proceeds from this Offering and
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock withheld and sold in this Offering to pay withholding tax obligations with respect to certain members of the Merging Blockers. Does not
	reflect
	the grant of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;restricted shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock to employees and non-employee directors in connection with this Offering.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Dilution
	is determined by subtracting pro forma net tangible book value per share of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock after the Offering from the initial public offering price per share of
	Class&nbsp;A Common Stock. Because our existing owners do not own any Class&nbsp;A Common Stock or other economic interests in Red Rock (other than shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock to be
	issued in the Blocker Mergers or in substitution of outstanding profit units of Station Holdco), we have presented dilution in pro forma net tangible book value per share of Class&nbsp;A Common
	Stock to investors in this Offering assuming that all of the holders of&nbsp;LLC Units in Station Holdco (other than Red Rock) exchanged their&nbsp;LLC Units, together with all outstanding shares
	of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock, for shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock on a one-for-one basis in order to more meaningfully present the dilutive impact on the investors in this Offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
	$1.00 increase (decrease) in the assumed initial public offering price of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;per share of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock would increase (decrease) our pro forma net tangible
	book value after this Offering by $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million and the dilution per share to new investors by $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, in each
	case assuming the number of shares of Class&nbsp;A Common
	Stock offered, as set forth on the cover page of this prospectus, remains the same and after deducting the estimated underwriting discounts and commissions and estimated offering expenses payable by
	us in connection with this Offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To
	the extent the underwriters' option to purchase additional shares is exercised, there will be further dilution to new investors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table sets forth, on the same pro forma basis, as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the number of shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock purchased from Red Rock, the total
	consideration paid, or to be paid, and the average price per share paid, or to be paid, by existing owners and by the new investors, assuming that all of the existing holders of&nbsp;LLC Units
	(other than Red Rock) exchanged their&nbsp;LLC Units, together with all outstanding shares of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock, for shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock on a one-for-one basis:
</FONT>
</P>

</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=72,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=122060,FOLIO='63',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]CM49601A.;97',USER='CHE108234',CD='10-MAR-2016;05:01' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_CM49601_1_64">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
	$1.00 increase (decrease) in the assumed initial public offering price of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;per share of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock would increase (decrease) total consideration paid
	by existing owners and new investors in this Offering by $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million, respectively, and would
	increase (decrease) the average price per share paid by existing
	owners and new investors by $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, respectively, assuming the number of shares of Class&nbsp;A Common
	Stock offered, as set forth on the cover page of this
	prospectus, remains the same and after deducting the estimated underwriting discounts and offering expenses payable by us in connection with this Offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To
	the extent the underwriters' option to purchase additional shares is exercised, there will be further dilution to new investors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	may choose to raise additional capital due to market conditions or strategic considerations even if we believe we have sufficient funds for our current or future operating plans. To
	the extent additional capital is raised through the sale of equity or convertible securities, the issuance of these securities could result in further dilution to our stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	64
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=73,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=426902,FOLIO='64',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]CM49601A.;97',USER='CHE108234',CD='10-MAR-2016;05:01' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_CM49601_1_65">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_CM49601_UNAUDITED_PRO_FORMA_CO__CM402449">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_TOC_CM49601_5">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	UNAUDITED PRO FORMA CONDENSED COMBINED FINANCIAL INFORMATION
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We derived the unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial information set forth below through the application of pro forma
	adjustments to the historical combined financial statements of Station Holdco included elsewhere in this prospectus. The combined financial statements of Station Holdco comprise the financial
	statements of Station Holdco, Station Voteco, Station&nbsp;LLC and Fertitta Entertainment and each of their respective consolidated subsidiaries. These entities are under the common control of
	brothers Frank J. Fertitta III and Lorenzo J. Fertitta, who collectively hold more than 50% of the voting and economic interest of Station Holdco, Station Voteco, Station&nbsp;LLC, and Fertitta
	Entertainment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have historically operated our business through Station&nbsp;LLC under management agreements with Fertitta Entertainment. In October 2015, Station&nbsp;LLC entered into an
	agreement to purchase all of the outstanding membership interests of Fertitta Entertainment for aggregate cash consideration of $460&nbsp;million (the "Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition"). Because
	Station Holdco and Fertitta Entertainment are under common control, the purchase constitutes an acquisition of an entity under common control for accounting purposes. The acquisition will result in a
	change in reporting entity requiring retrospective combination of the entities' consolidated financial statements as if the combination had been in effect since the inception of common control, which
	was established on April&nbsp;30, 2012. Our predecessor entity for accounting purposes is Station Holdco (the "Predecessor"). See "Presentation of Financial Information."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial information gives pro forma effect to the Offering and Reorganization Transactions as described under "The Reorganization
	of Our Corporate Structure" and "Use of Proceeds" and the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition, including the effect of the transfer of certain assets and repayment of certain liabilities of Fertitta
	Entertainment not included in the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition, as if such transactions occurred on January&nbsp;1, 2015
	in the case of the condensed combined statement of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, and on December&nbsp;31, 2015, in the case of the condensed combined balance sheet as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, and are based on available information and certain assumptions we believe are reasonable, but are subject to change. All pro forma adjustments and their underlying
	assumptions are described more fully in the notes to our unaudited pro forma condensed combined statements of operations and unaudited pro forma condensed combined balance sheet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial information should be read in conjunction with the sections of this prospectus captioned "The Reorganization of Our Corporate
	Structure," "Use of Proceeds," "Capitalization," "Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations" and the historical combined financial statements and related
	notes included elsewhere in this prospectus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial information was prepared in accordance with Article&nbsp;11 of Regulation&nbsp;S-X. The unaudited pro forma condensed combined
	financial information is included for informational purposes only and does not purport to reflect the results of operations or financial position that would have occurred had we operated as a public
	company during the periods presented. The unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial information does not purport to be indicative of our results of operations or financial position had the
	Offering and Reorganization Transactions occurred on the dates assumed. The unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial information also does not project our results of operations or financial
	position for any future period or date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	pro forma adjustments principally give effect to:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_20"></A>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the issuance of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shares of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock to our existing owners;
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	65
</FONT>
</P>

<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the execution of a tax receivable agreement by and between Red Rock and Station Holdco and the recognition of a related payable under
	such agreement arising as a result of the purchase by Red Rock of&nbsp;LLC Units from certain of our existing owners;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the recognition of deferred tax assets related to the increase in the tax basis of the LLC Units in Station Holdco purchased from
	certain of our existing owners as compared to their GAAP carrying value and deferred tax liabilities related to the book basis of the LLC Units held by the Blocker Merger entities, exceeding the tax
	basis of the LLC units, based on an effective income tax rate of 35%;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the consolidation of Station Holdco and its consolidated subsidiaries into Red Rock's financial statements in accordance with
	Accounting Standards Codification ("ASC")&nbsp;810, pursuant to which Red Rock will record a noncontrolling interest in Station Holdco;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	with regard to the unaudited pro forma condensed combined statements of operations, a provision for corporate income taxes on the
	income attributable to Red Rock at an effective rate of 35%, which includes a provision for U.S. Federal income taxes. The operations of the Company are primarily conducted in the state of Nevada,
	which does not have a corporate level income tax. The Company has operations in Michigan and California which are insignificant;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	compensation expense associated with the grant of stock options and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;restricted shares of Class&nbsp;A
	Common Stock
	to employees and non-employee directors in connection with our new Red Rock Resorts,&nbsp;Inc. 2016 Equity Incentive Plan; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	transaction expenses incurred in connection with this Offering.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have not made an adjustment for additional accounting, legal and information technology costs that we expect to incur as a result of being a public company. As a public company, we
	expect our general and administrative expenses to increase in an amount that we cannot determine at this time due to greater expenses related to corporate governance, SEC reporting and other
	compliance matters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial information presented assumes no exercise by the underwriters of the option to purchase up to an additional&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shares of
	Class&nbsp;A Common Stock from us and that the shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock to be sold in this Offering are sold at $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;per share of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, which is the
	midpoint of the price range indicated on the front cover of this prospectus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	66
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_22"></A>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_CU49601_1_69">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_CU49601_NOTES_TO_UNAUDITED_PRO_FORMA_C__NOT02762">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_TOC_CU49601_1">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	NOTES TO UNAUDITED PRO FORMA CONDENSED COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	1. Basis of Presentation and the Offering
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We derived the unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial information set forth below through the application of pro forma adjustments to the historical combined financial
	statements of Station Holdco included elsewhere in this prospectus. We have historically operated our business through Station&nbsp;LLC under management agreements with Fertitta Entertainment. Our
	predecessor entity for accounting purposes is Station Holdco. The combined financial statements of Station Holdco comprise the financial statements of Station Holdco, Station Voteco,
	Station&nbsp;LLC, and Fertitta Entertainment and their respective consolidated subsidiaries. The following unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial information gives pro forma effect to the
	Offering and Reorganization Transactions, as described under "The Reorganization of Our Corporate Structure" and "Use of Proceeds" and the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition, including the transfer of
	certain assets and repayment of certain liabilities of Fertitta Entertainment not included in the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition, as if such transactions occurred on January&nbsp;1, 2015 in the
	case of the condensed combined statement of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, and on December&nbsp;31, 2015 in the case of the condensed combined balance sheet as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, and are based on available information and certain assumptions we believe are reasonable, but are subject to change. All pro forma adjustments and their underlying
	assumptions are described more fully in the notes to our unaudited pro forma condensed combined statements of operations and unaudited pro forma condensed combined balance sheet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and on December&nbsp;31, 2015, Station Holdco represented all of our operations and held all of our assets and liabilities. Red Rock was
	incorporated September&nbsp;9, 2015 and has not conducted any operations since its inception. Red Rock does not have any assets or liabilities. Accordingly, the unaudited pro forma condensed
	combined statements of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and the unaudited pro forma condensed combined balance sheet as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 present the historical
	financial condition of the Predecessor as a starting point for the pro forma presentation. As described in "The Reorganization of Our Corporate Structure," Red Rock will become the sole managing
	member of Station&nbsp;LLC. The unaudited pro forma condensed combined balance sheet and condensed combined statements of operations are based on the historical combined balance sheet and statements
	of operations of Station Holdco and related adjustments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	2. Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Combined Balance Sheet Adjustments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Combined Balance Sheet reflects the effect of the following pro forma adjustments:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reflects
	the net effect on cash and cash equivalents of the receipt of gross proceeds of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million from the Offering, based on an
	assumed sale of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock at an assumed initial public offering price of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;per
	share, which is the midpoint of the price range listed on the
	cover page of this prospectus, a portion of which will be used to purchase newly-issued&nbsp;LLC Units in Station Holdco. Red Rock intends to use the remaining net proceeds to purchase&nbsp;LLC
	Units from certain of Station Holdco's existing owners. A $1.00 increase or decrease in the assumed initial public offering price of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;per share would increase or decrease the net
	proceeds we receive from this Offering by approximately $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million, assuming the number of shares offered by us as set forth on the cover page of this prospectus remains the same
	and after deducting offering expenses. See "Use of Proceeds."
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	69
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_CU49601_1_70">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	NOTES TO UNAUDITED PRO FORMA CONDENSED COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	2. Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Combined Balance Sheet Adjustments (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Cash
	adjustments are as follows (in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
</UL>

</DIV>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Pro
	forma adjustments reflect the effects of the tax receivable agreement on our combined balance sheet as a result of Red Rock's purchase of&nbsp;LLC
	Units from certain existing owners. Pursuant to the tax receivable agreement, Red Rock will be required to make cash payments to these existing owners equal to 85% of the savings, if any, in U.S.
	federal, state and local taxes that Red Rock actually realizes, or in some circumstances is deemed to realize, as a result of certain future tax benefits to which Red Rock may become entitled. These
	tax benefit payments are not necessarily conditioned upon one or more of the existing owners maintaining a continued ownership interest in either Station Holdco or Red Rock. Red Rock expects to
	benefit from the remaining 15% of the tax benefits, if any, that it may actually realize.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As
	a result, as of the date of Red Rock's purchase of&nbsp;LLC Units from existing owners in this Offering, on a cumulative basis, the net effect of accounting for income taxes and the tax
	receivable agreement on our financial statements will be a net decrease in stockholders' equity. The amounts to be recorded for both the deferred tax assets and the liability for our obligations under
	the tax receivable agreement have been estimated and are based on the assumption that there are no material changes in the relevant tax law and that we earn sufficient taxable income in each year to
	realize the full tax benefit of the amortization of our assets. A summary of the adjustments is as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	we will record a net increase of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million in deferred tax assets for estimated income tax effects
	of the increase in the tax basis of the purchased&nbsp;LLC Units, and a decrease in deferred tax assets resulting from the book basis of the LLC Units held by the Blocker Merger entities exceeding
	the tax basis of the LLC Units, based on an effective income tax rate of 35%. The operations of the Company are primarily conducted in the state of Nevada, which does not have a corporate level income
	tax. The Company has minimal operations in Michigan and California which result in nominal state and local income taxes;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	we will record a $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million liability due to existing owners under the tax receivable agreement,
	which represents 85% of the estimated realizable tax benefit resulting from (i)&nbsp;the increase in tax basis in the tangible and intangible assets of Station Holdco on the date of this Offering
	related to the purchased&nbsp;LLC Units as noted above and (ii)&nbsp;certain other tax benefits related to entering into the tax receivable agreement, including tax benefits attributable to
	payments under the tax receivable agreement; and
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	70
</FONT>
</P>

</A>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	NOTES TO UNAUDITED PRO FORMA CONDENSED COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	2. Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Combined Balance Sheet Adjustments (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	we will record a net decrease to additional paid-in capital of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million, relating to (x)&nbsp;the
	Blocker Mergers, (y)&nbsp;increase in the tax basis of certain LLC Units, and (z)&nbsp;the difference between the increase in deferred tax assets and the increase in liability due to existing
	owners under the tax receivable agreement (see note&nbsp;(e)).
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Pursuant
	to the terms of the exchange agreement that we will enter into in connection with the Offering and Reorganization Transactions, holders of&nbsp;LLC Units will have the right to exchange
	their&nbsp;LLC Units (together with shares of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock) for shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock or cash, at our election. Any exchanges of&nbsp;LLC Units (together with shares
	of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock) for shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock pursuant to the exchange agreement may result in increases in the tax basis of the tangible and intangible assets of Station
	Holdco (85% of the realized tax benefits from which will be due to the exchanging&nbsp;LLC Unit holders and recorded as an additional payable pursuant to the tax receivable agreement) that otherwise
	would not have been available. These exchanges and the resulting effects of the tax receivable agreement on our combined financial statements have not been reflected in the unaudited pro forma
	condensed combined financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(c)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Expenses
	related to this Offering and the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition are estimated to be approximately $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million. Of this
	amount approximately $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million is expected to be paid from the proceeds received by Red Rock in this Offering (see note&nbsp;(a) above). For the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015, we expensed $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million of costs related to these transactions, of which $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million is recorded in accrued liabilities and will be paid after
	December&nbsp;31, 2015. Included in other assets are deferred offering expenses of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million, of which $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million is recorded in accrued liabilities at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015. An aggregate of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million of such expenses will be offset against equity (see note&nbsp;(e)) and the remainder will be expensed.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(d)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reflects
	the Offering and Reorganization Transactions, as described under "The Reorganization of Our Corporate Structure," including (i)&nbsp;the
	elimination of existing members' equity of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million in consolidation of Station Holdco into the financial statements of Red Rock, (ii)&nbsp;the issuance of shares of
	Class&nbsp;B Common Stock to Station Holdco's existing owners, (iii)&nbsp;the issuance of shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock in the Blocker Mergers (iv)&nbsp;the issuance of shares of
	Class&nbsp;A Common Stock in this Offering for $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million, and (v)&nbsp;the issuance of restricted shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock to certain employees or former
	employees in substitution of profit units held by those individuals in Station Holdco.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	71
</FONT>
</P>

<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:10PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Net proceeds received by Red Rock from this offering
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- -->
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="WHITE" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:10PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Offering expenses, excluding $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million recorded in accrued liabilities representing unpaid expenses
	recognized for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

</DIV>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(f)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	After
	the Offering and Reorganization Transactions, as described in "The Reorganization of Our Corporate Structure," our only material asset will be the
	direct and indirect ownership of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;% of the&nbsp;LLC Units and voting interest in Station LLC and our only business will be to act as the sole managing member of Station Holdco.
	Therefore, pursuant to ASC&nbsp;810
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Consolidations
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, we will consolidate the financial results of Station Holdco into our financial statements. The
	ownership interests of the other members of Station Holdco will be accounted for as a noncontrolling interest in our financial statements after this Offering. Immediately following this Offering, the
	noncontrolling interest will represent&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;% of the outstanding&nbsp;LLC Units calculated as follows:
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>

<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(h)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	determined the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition will constitute an acquisition of an entity under common control which will not require the application
	of the acquisition method of accounting under ASC 805,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Business Combinations
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	. Station Holdco and Fertitta Entertainment and their respective
	consolidated subsidiaries are under the common control of brothers Frank J. Fertitta III and Lorenzo J. Fertitta, who collectively hold more than 50% of their voting and economic interests.
	Accordingly, the column representing the historical financial information of Station Holdco, our predecessor for accounting purposes, represents the effect of the retrospective combination of the
	financial statements of Station Holdco and Fertitta Entertainment. The pro forma adjustments reflect the transfer of related party notes receivable and certain other assets and liabilities of Fertitta
	Entertainment prior to the consummation of the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition and the repayment of all amounts outstanding under the Fertitta Entertainment credit facility substantially
	concurrently with the consummation of the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition. As a result of such transactions, we did not acquire such assets and liabilities in connection with the Fertitta
	Entertainment Acquisition. In addition, the pro forma adjustment to current portion of long-term debt reflects $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million in borrowings under the Red Rock revolving credit
	facility, the proceeds of which will be used for the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(i)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reflects
	a $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million distribution to the equity holders of Fertitta Entertainment in consideration paid in respect of the
	$460&nbsp;million purchase price for the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition, less $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million which will be repaid to the lenders under the Fertitta Entertainment credit facility
	and the impact of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million in assets, net of liabilities, excluded from the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition (see note&nbsp;(h)).
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	3. Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Combined Statement of Operations Adjustments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Combined Statements of Operations reflect the effect of the following pro forma adjustments:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reflects
	compensation expense associated with the grant of stock options and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;restricted shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock to employees
	and non-employee directors in connection with our new Red Rock Resorts,&nbsp;Inc. 2016 Equity Incentive Plan in connection with this Offering.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	connection with this Offering, restricted shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock will be issued to certain employees or former employees in substitution of profit units held by those individuals in
	Station Holdco. The fair value of the replacement awards is equal to the fair value of the
</FONT>
</P>

<UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	A
	hypothetical 0.125% increase or decrease in the expected weighted average interest rate would increase or decrease interest expense associated with borrowings under Station&nbsp;LLC's revolving
	credit facility by approximately $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(d)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reflects
	a pro forma adjustment for the loss on extinguishment of debt recorded related to the March&nbsp;26, 2015 amendment to the Fertitta Entertainment
	credit agreement.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(e)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Following
	the Offering and Reorganization Transactions, we will be subject to U.S. federal income taxes and state and local taxes with respect to our
	allocable share of any net taxable income of Station Holdco. As a result, the pro forma statement of operations reflects an adjustment to provide for corporate income taxes at our estimated effective
	rate of 35% for U.S. federal income taxes. The operations of the Company are primarily conducted in the state of Nevada, which does not have a corporate level income tax. The Company has minimal
	operations in Michigan and California which will result in nominal state and local income taxes.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	74
</FONT>
</P>

<UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	effective tax rate includes a rate benefit attributable to the fact that, after this transaction, approximately&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;% of Red Rock's earnings will not be subject to corporate level taxes
	as the applicable income tax expense will be incurred by, and be the obligation of, the members of Station Holdco holding the noncontrolling interests.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(f)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	After
	the Offering and Reorganization Transactions, as described in "The Reorganization of Our Corporate Structure," Red Rock will become the sole managing
	member of Station Holdco and will initially have a minority economic interest in Station Holdco but will have 100% of the voting power and control the management of Station Holdco. Immediately
	following the Offering, the noncontrolling interest, representing the ownership interests of the members of Station Holdco other than Red Rock, will be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;%. Net income attributable to the
	noncontrolling interest holders of Red Rock represents&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;% of income before provision for income taxes, as well as net income attributable to noncontrolling interest holders of
	Station&nbsp;LLC.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(g)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Basic
	and diluted pro forma income per share from continuing operations does not consider Class&nbsp;B Common Stock as these shares do not participate in
	earnings of Red Rock. As a result, the shares of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock are not considered participating securities and are not included in the weighted average shares outstanding for purposes of
	computing pro forma net income per share from continuing operations. Diluted pro forma income per share from continuing operations is calculated using the treasury stock method with respect to
	restricted stock and stock options, and the if-converted method for the exchange of&nbsp;LLC Units and Class&nbsp;B Common Stock for an equal number of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	75
</FONT>
</P>

<UL>

	statements which, except for periods ended on or before December&nbsp;31, 2011, are contained elsewhere in this prospectus.

	should read the financial information presented below in conjunction with Station Holdco's combined financial statements and accompanying notes included elsewhere in this prospectus,
	as well as "The Reorganization of Our Corporate Structure," "Use of Proceeds," "Capitalization" and "Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operation," included
	elsewhere in this prospectus. The information presented below reflects financial data for:

	December&nbsp;31, 2011;

</FONT>

	period from January&nbsp;1, 2011 through June&nbsp;16, 2011.

<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	During
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014, 2013, 2012 and 2011 we recorded approximately $6.3&nbsp;million, $11.7&nbsp;million,
	$1.2&nbsp;million, $10.1&nbsp;million and $2.1&nbsp;million, respectively, in non-cash asset impairment charges to write down certain long lived assets to their estimated fair values. Included
	in these amounts is a goodwill impairment charge of $1.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	Write-downs
	and other charges, net primarily represent losses on asset disposals, severance expense and non-routine transactions.

<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(c)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	During
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we recognized a $4.1&nbsp;million loss on extinguishment of debt, primarily related to
	Station&nbsp;LLC's March 2014 repricing of its term loan facility. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, we recognized a $147.1&nbsp;million loss on extinguishment of debt, primarily
	related to the refinancing of $2.1&nbsp;billion of our then outstanding debt. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2012, we recognized a $51.8&nbsp;million loss on extinguishment of debt
	related to the refinancing of approximately $517&nbsp;million of our then outstanding debt, mainly the write-off of unamortized debt discount and debt issuance costs related to the previous credit
	facilities. See Note&nbsp;10 to the Annual Combined Financial Statements included elsewhere in this prospectus for additional information.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(d)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	For
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, 2013 and 2012, we recorded gains of $49.1&nbsp;million, $17.0&nbsp;million and $102.8&nbsp;million,
	respectively, pursuant to repayments on our advances for Graton Resort. The gains were a result of the adjustment of the carrying amount of the project to fair value upon adoption of fresh-start
	reporting in June 2011, which resulted in the carrying amount of the advances being less than the amount due from the Graton Tribe.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>

	(e)
</FONT>

	Discontinued
	operations represents the results of Fertitta Interactive, which ceased operations in the fourth quarter of 2014. See Note&nbsp;19 to the
	Annual Combined Financial Statements included elsewhere in this prospectus for additional information.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(f)
</FONT>
</DT>

<FONT SIZE=1>
	For
	the period from January&nbsp;1, 2011 through June&nbsp;16, 2011, our Predecessors recognized net gains of approximately $3.9&nbsp;billion as a
	direct result of the Chapter&nbsp;11 bankruptcy cases.
</FONT>
</DD>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents

</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_DA49601_MANAGEMENT_S_DISCUSSION_AND_AN__MAN03466">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_TOC_DA49601_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF
<BR>
	FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	You should read the discussion and analysis in this section in conjunction with "Presentation of Financial
	Information," "Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Combined Financial Information," "Selected Historical Combined Financial and Other Data" and the combined financial statements and accompanying notes
	included elsewhere in this prospectus. In addition to historical information, this discussion and analysis contains forward-looking statements that are subject to numerous risks and other
	uncertainties, including, but not limited to, those described in the "Risk Factors" section of this prospectus. Our actual results may differ materially from those anticipated in the forward-looking
	statements. See "Risk Factors" and "Cautionary Statement Concerning Forward-Looking Statements."
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are a gaming, development and management company established in 1976 that develops and operates casino entertainment properties. We
	currently own and operate nine major gaming and entertainment facilities and ten smaller casinos (three of which are 50% owned) in the Las Vegas regional market. In addition, we manage Graton Resort
	in Sonoma County, California, which opened in November 2013, and Gun Lake in Allegan County, Michigan, which opened in February 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our principal source of revenue and operating income is gaming, primarily slot revenue, and our non-gaming offerings include restaurants, hotels and other entertainment amenities. Our
	operating results are greatly dependent on the level of casino revenue generated at our properties. A substantial portion of our operating income is generated from our gaming operations, primarily
	from slot play, which represents approximately 80% to 85% of our casino revenue. The majority of our revenue is cash-based and as a result, fluctuations in our revenues have a direct impact on our
	cash flows from operations. Because our business is capital intensive, we rely heavily on the ability of our properties to generate operating cash flow to repay debt financing and fund capital
	expenditures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A significant portion of our business is dependent upon customers who live and/or work in the Las Vegas metropolitan area. The Las Vegas economy, although severely impacted by the
	recession and housing crisis that spanned from 2008 to 2011, began to stabilize in 2012 and, based on population and employment growth, is once again one of the fastest growing economies in the United
	States. Based on a recent U.S. Census Bureau release Nevada was third among all states in percentage growth of population from June 2014 to July 2015. In addition, based on preliminary data for
	December 2015 from the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, Las Vegas experienced a 2.0% year-over-year increase in employment, resulting in an unemployment rate of 6.2% which has declined from 14.1% in
	July 2011. Businesses and consumers in Las Vegas continue to increase their spending as evidenced by 30 consecutive months of year-over-year increases in taxable retail sales from July 2013 to
	December 2015. Home values have also improved significantly over the past several years with the median price of an existing single family home in Las Vegas up approximately 84% at December 2015
	compared to January 2012, as reported by the Greater Las Vegas Association of Realtors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding recent improvements in employment, taxable sales and home prices, the Las Vegas economy has not fully recovered from the impacts of the economic downturn; however, we
	believe the recent stabilization of the Las Vegas economy, positive trends in many of the key economic indicators and future projects and infrastructure investments provide a foundation for future
	growth in our business. Although we experienced improved operating results over the past few years due, in part, to more favorable local economic conditions and reduced gasoline prices, we cannot be
	sure if, or how long, these favorable market conditions will persist or that they will continue to positively impact our results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	79
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=88,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=581751,FOLIO='79',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]DA49601A.;55',USER='ABEAULI',CD='14-MAR-2016;21:09' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DA49601_1_80">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Highlights for 2015 include the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our net revenues grew by 4.7%, our Adjusted EBITDA increased 13.1% and our income from continuing operations increased by 9.4% for the
	year.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Adjusted EBITDA margin improved 250 basis points to 33.4% for the year.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional information about our results of operations is included herein and in the notes to our Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Our Key Performance Indicators
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We use certain key indicators to measure our performance.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Gaming revenue measures:
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Slot handle and table game drop are measures of volume. Slot handle represents the dollar amount wagered in slot machines, and table
	game drop represents the total amount of cash and net markers issued that are deposited in table game drop boxes.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Win represents the amount of wagers retained by us and recorded as casino revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Hold represents win as a percentage of slot handle or table game drop.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As our customers are primarily Las Vegas residents, our hold percentages are generally consistent from period to period. Fluctuations in our casino revenue are primarily due to the
	volume and spending levels of customers at our properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Food and beverage revenue measures:
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Average guest check is a measure of sales volume and product offerings, and represents the average amount spent per customer visit.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Number of guests served is an indicator of volume.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Room revenue measures:
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Occupancy is calculated by dividing total occupied rooms, including complimentary rooms, by total rooms available.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Average daily rate ("ADR") is calculated by dividing total room revenue, which includes the retail value of complimentary rooms, by
	total rooms occupied, including complimentary rooms.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Revenue per available room is calculated by dividing total room revenue by total rooms available.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Effects of the Reorganization of Our Corporate Structure
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Red Rock was formed for the purpose of this Offering and has engaged to date only in activities in contemplation of this Offering. Red
	Rock will be a holding company that has no material assets other than its direct and indirect equity interest in Station Holdco and its voting interest in Station&nbsp;LLC. For more information
	regarding our reorganization and holding company structure, see "The Reorganization of Our Corporate Structure." Upon completion of this Offering, all of our business will be conducted through Station
	Holdco and its subsidiaries, and the financial results of Station Holdco and its consolidated subsidiaries will be included in the consolidated financial statements of Red Rock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior to the Offering and Reorganization Transactions, Station Holdco was not subject to any entity-level federal income taxation. As a result, the members of Station Holdco paid taxes
	with respect
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	80
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=89,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=541050,FOLIO='80',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]DA49601A.;55',USER='ABEAULI',CD='14-MAR-2016;21:09' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DA49601_1_81">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	to their allocable shares of its net taxable income. Following the Offering and Reorganization Transactions, all of the earnings of Red Rock will be subject to federal income taxation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We expect that exchanges of&nbsp;LLC Units, as well as the initial purchase with the net proceeds of this Offering of&nbsp;LLC Units from certain of our existing owners, will result
	in increases in the tax basis in our share of the tangible and intangible assets of Station&nbsp;LLC that otherwise would not have been available. These increases in tax basis may reduce the amount
	of tax that Red Rock would otherwise be required to pay in the future. The tax receivable agreement will require us to pay 85% of the amount of benefits, if any, that we realize (or are deemed to
	realize in the case of an early termination payment by us, a change in control or a material breach by us of our obligations under the tax receivable agreement, as discussed above) to the existing
	holders of&nbsp;LLC Units (and their permitted transferees). Furthermore, payments under the tax receivable agreement will give rise to additional tax benefits and therefore additional payments
	under the tax receivable agreement itself. See "Certain Relationships and Related Party Transactions&#151;Tax Receivable Agreement."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Presentation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our combined financial statements include the financial statements of Station Holdco, Station Voteco, Station&nbsp;LLC and its
	consolidated subsidiaries, and Fertitta Entertainment and its consolidated subsidiaries. Because these entities are under the common control of brothers Frank J. Fertitta III and Lorenzo J. Fertitta,
	our combined financial statements include the historical accounts of Fertitta Entertainment for all periods presented. Additional information about our results of operations is included herein and in
	the notes to our audited combined financial statements for the three years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 (the "Annual Combined Financial Statements") included elsewhere in this prospectus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We view each of our Las Vegas casino properties as individual operating segments. We aggregate all of our Las Vegas operating segments into one reportable segment because all of our Las
	Vegas properties offer similar products, cater to the same customer base, have the same regulatory and tax structure, share the same marketing techniques, all are directed by a centralized management
	structure, and have similar economic characteristics. We also aggregate our Native American management arrangements into one reportable segment. The results of operations for our Native American
	management segment are discussed in the section entitled "Management Fee Revenue" below and the results of operations of our Las Vegas operations are discussed in the remaining sections of "Results of
	Operations" below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	81
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	n/m
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	=
	not meaningful
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net Revenues.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 increased by 4.7% to $1.35&nbsp;billion as compared to
	$1.29&nbsp;billion
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase in net revenues during 2015 reflected increases in casino, food and beverage, room and management fee revenue, offset slightly by a decrease
	in other revenues, all of which are discussed below. We believe the increase in
	net revenues was primarily due to the ongoing economic recovery described above, as well as our strategic marketing activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 increased by 2.8% to $1.29&nbsp;billion as compared to $1.26&nbsp;billion for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The
	increase in net revenues during 2014 was due to management fee revenue from Graton Resort, which opened in November 2013, as well as improvements in casino and room revenue. The components of net
	revenues are discussed below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating Income.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating income increased 21.1% to $287.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to
	$237.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 due to
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	82
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=91,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=14114,FOLIO='82',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]DA49601A.;55',USER='ABEAULI',CD='14-MAR-2016;21:09' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DA49601_1_83">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	improvements in operating income from casino, food and beverage, and rooms in addition to higher management fee revenue from Graton Resort. Operating income increased by 10.3% to $237.1&nbsp;million
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to $215.0&nbsp;million for the prior year due to increased management fee revenue from both Graton Resort and Gun Lake, as well as
	improvements in operating income from casino and rooms. The components of operating income are discussed below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Casino.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Casino revenues increased $24.8&nbsp;million to $922.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to
	$897.4&nbsp;million for the prior year, primarily due to higher slot and table games revenue, partially offset by lower race and sports revenue. The increase in slot revenue was attributable to a
	2.9% increase in slot handle. The increase in table games revenue was primarily attributable to a 6.5% increase in drop. The decrease in race and sports revenue was primarily due to a
	0.8&nbsp;percentage point decrease in hold percentage. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, casino expenses increased by $6.0&nbsp;million or 1.8% as compared to the prior year,
	commensurate with the increase in revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Casino revenues increased to $897.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to $882.2&nbsp;million for the prior year. The improvement was primarily due
	to increased slot revenues and sports win. Casino expenses increased slightly for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the prior year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Food and Beverage.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Food and beverage revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 increased to $251.2&nbsp;million as compared to
	$239.2&nbsp;million for 2014. The improvement was primarily due to increased volume at our food and beverage outlets, including the impact of several new restaurants, as well as higher catering
	revenue from our convention and meeting business. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the number of restaurant guests served increased by 1.3% as compared to the prior year, and the average
	guest check increased by 3.9%. Food and beverage expenses increased by 3.5% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the prior year, mainly due to the increased volume at our food
	and beverage establishments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Food and beverage revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 increased to $239.2&nbsp;million as compared to $235.7&nbsp;million for 2013. The improvement was primarily due
	to a $3.9&nbsp;million increase in catering revenue, partially offset by the impact of the closure of several restaurants during the year for renovation. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014,
	the average guest check increased by 2.5% as compared to the prior year, and the number of restaurant guests served decreased by 1.8% due to the restaurant closures. Food and beverage expense for the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 decreased as compared to the prior year, mainly due to lower payroll and related costs as a result of the restaurant closures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Room.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table shows key information about our hotel operations:
</FONT>
</P>
