<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Room revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 increased by 9.1% to $122.9&nbsp;million as compared to $112.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 due
	to a 290 basis point increase in occupancy rate and a 6.1% improvement in ADR as compared to the prior year. We believe the improvement in our hotel results is due to our ongoing focus on yield
	management. Room expenses increased by 2.4% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the prior year, primarily due to higher payroll and related costs resulting from the higher
	occupancy rate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	83
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=92,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=981846,FOLIO='83',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]DA49601A.;55',USER='ABEAULI',CD='14-MAR-2016;21:09' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DA49601_1_84">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Room revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 increased by 6.7% to $112.7&nbsp;million as compared to $105.6&nbsp;million for the prior year due to a 170 basis point
	improvement in the occupancy rate and a 5.5% improvement in ADR. Room expenses for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 increased by 5.6% as compared to the prior year, mainly due to higher payroll
	and related costs associated with the increased occupancy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other revenues primarily include revenues from tenant leases, retail outlets, bowling, spas and
	entertainment. Other revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 decreased by 1.1% to $69.7&nbsp;million as compared to $70.5&nbsp;million for the prior year. Other expenses for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 decreased by 12.2% as compared to the prior year. The decrease in other revenues and other expenses for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was mainly due to lower
	fuel prices at our Wild Wild West truck plaza. Other revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 increased by 4.6% to $70.5&nbsp;million as compared to $67.4&nbsp;million for the prior
	year, primarily due to increased revenue from our retail shops. Other expenses for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 increased by 9.0% as compared to the prior year, largely due to the increased
	sales at our retail shops.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management Fee Revenue.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management fee revenue is based on the operating results of our managed properties, and primarily represents fees
	earned from
	our management agreements with Graton Resort, which opened in November 2013, and Gun Lake. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, management fee revenue increased to $88.9&nbsp;million as
	compared to $68.8&nbsp;million for the prior year due to improved results at both Graton Resort and Gun Lake. This improvement resulted from increased casino revenues due to higher slot handle, as
	well as lower interest costs as a result of debt refinancings at Graton Resort. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, management fee revenue increased to $68.8&nbsp;million as compared to
	$59.8&nbsp;million for the prior year, primarily due to a full year of management fees from Graton Resort in 2014, compared to two months in 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management fee revenue also includes reimbursable costs, which represent amounts received or due pursuant to our management agreements with Native American tribes, primarily the Graton
	Tribe, for the reimbursement of expenses, primarily payroll costs, that we incur on their behalf. We recognize reimbursable cost revenues on a gross basis with an offsetting amount charged to
	operating expenses. Management fee revenue for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013 included $7.3&nbsp;million, $7.5&nbsp;million and $12.6&nbsp;million in reimbursable costs,
	respectively. Reimbursable costs for Graton Resort were higher for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 due to costs incurred in preparation for its opening.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling, General and Administrative ("SG&amp;A").
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SG&amp;A expenses increased by 2.4% to $327.9&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 as
	compared to $320.1&nbsp;million for the prior year, mainly due to an increase in share-based compensation expense and a $2.5&nbsp;million donation to the University of Nevada, Las Vegas ("UNLV")
	to contribute to the construction of a new building for the hotel college, partially offset by a net decrease in various other SG&amp;A expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SG&amp;A expenses decreased by 2.3% to $320.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to $327.8&nbsp;million for the prior year, mainly due to a
	$5.1&nbsp;million reduction in reimbursable expenses under our management agreements, partially offset by increases in various other SG&amp;A expenses. Excluding reimbursable expenses, SG&amp;A expenses for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 decreased less than 1.0% as compared to the prior year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation and Amortization.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation and amortization expense for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 increased to
	$137.9&nbsp;million
	as compared to $128.0&nbsp;million for the prior year due to fixed asset purchases as well as accelerated depreciation related to room remodeling projects. Depreciation and amortization expense for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 decreased slightly to $128.0&nbsp;million as compared to $129.0&nbsp;million for 2013, primarily due to shorter-lived assets becoming fully depreciated,
	partially offset by amortization of the Graton management contract intangible asset, which began in November 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	84
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=93,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=731392,FOLIO='84',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]DA49601A.;55',USER='ABEAULI',CD='14-MAR-2016;21:09' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DA49601_1_85">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Asset Impairment.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we recognized asset impairment charges totaling $6.3&nbsp;million,
	primarily
	representing the write-down of two parcels of undeveloped land in Las Vegas to their estimated fair values. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we sold approximately 101 acres of land held
	for development in Reno, Nevada for approximately $2.0&nbsp;million and recognized an impairment loss of $11.7&nbsp;million to write down the carrying amount of the land to its estimated fair
	value less cost to sell. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, we recognized a goodwill impairment charge of $1.2&nbsp;million related to two taverns.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Write-downs and Other Charges, net.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Write-downs and other charges, net includes charges such as losses on asset disposals, severance
	expense and
	non-routine transactions. Write-downs and other charges, net, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 totaled $9.5&nbsp;million, primarily representing $5.8&nbsp;million in transaction-related
	expenses for the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition and this Offering. Write-downs and other charges, net for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 also included a $1.7&nbsp;million net loss on
	the disposal of assets, primarily property and equipment and the write-off of our $1.8&nbsp;million investment in Tejon, partially offset by $6.7&nbsp;million in net gains on disposal of land held
	for development. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, write-downs and other charges, net totaled $21.0&nbsp;million, primarily due to the abandonment of certain assets, including an
	amphitheater and an outdoor water feature, as well as several restaurant renovation projects. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, write-downs and other charges, net totaled
	$11.9&nbsp;million, primarily representing net losses on asset disposals.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest Expense, net.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table presents summarized information about our interest expense (in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_28"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>

<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense, net, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was $144.5&nbsp;million as compared to $151.7&nbsp;million for the prior year. The decrease in interest expense,
	net as compared to the prior year was primarily due to principal reductions on our $1.625&nbsp;billion term loan and the impact of the March 2014 repricing of the term loan, which resulted in an
	interest rate reduction of 75 basis points on that portion of our debt. Interest expense, net, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was $151.7&nbsp;million as compared to
	$165.2&nbsp;million for the prior year. The term loan repricing reduced our cash interest expense by approximately $8.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense, net, includes the impact of our interest rate swaps that were designated in cash flow hedging relationships, which effectively converted $920&nbsp;million of our
	variable-rate debt to a fixed rate. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, interest rate swaps increased our interest expense by $8.5&nbsp;million, $12.9&nbsp;million and
	$13.1&nbsp;million, respectively. These amounts included deferred losses on discontinued cash flow hedging relationships that were being reclassified from accumulated other comprehensive loss into
	interest expense while the previously hedged cash flows continued to occur.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Loss on Extinguishment of Debt.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we recognized a $4.1&nbsp;million loss on extinguishment of
	debt,
	primarily related to the March 2014 repricing of our Term Loan Facility. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, we recognized a $147.1&nbsp;million loss on extinguishment of debt, primarily
	related to the refinancing of approximately $2.1&nbsp;billion of our then outstanding long-term debt. These losses primarily resulted from the write-off of unamortized debt discounts and debt
	issuance costs related to previous credit facilities. See Note&nbsp;10 to the Combined Financial Statements for additional information about these transactions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	85
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=94,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=952721,FOLIO='85',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]DA49601A.;55',USER='ABEAULI',CD='14-MAR-2016;21:09' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DE49601_1_86">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gain on Native American Development.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, we recognized gains as a result of repayments on
	our
	advances to Graton Resort. The gains were due to the adjustment of the carrying amount of the advances to fair value upon our adoption of fresh-start reporting in 2011, and our deferral of the return
	on the advances until the carrying amount had been recovered and the return was realizable. In 2013, we recognized a gain of $17.0&nbsp;million on the advances, and in 2014 we recognized a gain of
	$49.1&nbsp;million when we received the final payment of the remaining amounts due from the Graton Tribe. We have no ongoing contractual obligation related to amounts collected from the Graton
	Tribe, and the amounts are nonrefundable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Discontinued Operations.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Discontinued operations represents the operating results of Fertitta Interactive, which ceased operating in
	November 2014.
	The net loss from discontinued operations for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013 was $0.2&nbsp;million, $42.5&nbsp;million and $25.0&nbsp;million, respectively. See
	Note&nbsp;19 to the Combined Financial Statements for additional information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Financial Condition and Liquidity
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, our primary cash requirements following the consummation of this Offering for 2016, including the
	impact of the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition, are expected to include (i)&nbsp;approximately $460&nbsp;million for the purchase price for the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition,
	(ii)&nbsp;required principal and interest payments on our indebtedness, totaling approximately $89&nbsp;million and $120&nbsp;million, respectively, (iii)&nbsp;approximately
	$100&nbsp;million to $125&nbsp;million for capital expenditures, and (iv)&nbsp;distributions to our stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	expect to fund the purchase price for the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition with a portion of the net proceeds from this Offering and borrowings under our $350&nbsp;million
	revolving credit facility (the "Revolving Credit Facility"). We believe that cash flows from operations, available borrowings under our Revolving Credit Facility, other debt financings and existing
	cash balances will be adequate to satisfy our anticipated uses of capital for the next twelve months. We regularly assess our projected capital requirements for capital expenditures, repayment of debt
	obligations, and payment of other general corporate and operational needs. In the long term, we expect that we will fund our capital requirements with a combination of cash generated from operations,
	borrowings under our Revolving Credit Facility and the issuance of new debt or equity as market conditions may permit. However, our cash flow and ability to obtain debt or equity financing on terms
	that are satisfactory to us, or at all, may be affected by a variety of factors, many of which are outside of our control, including competition, general economic and business conditions and financial
	markets. As a result, we cannot provide any assurance that we will generate sufficient income and liquidity to meet all of our liquidity requirements or other obligations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The indenture (the "Indenture") governing our 7.50% Senior Notes due 2021 (the "7.50% Senior Notes") and the credit agreement (the "Credit Facility") governing our $1.625&nbsp;billion
	term loan facility (the "Term Loan Facility") and Revolving Credit Facility each contain, and future debt financing arrangement may contain, covenants limiting the ability of Station&nbsp;LLC to
	make distributions and other payments to its members, including Station Holdco. Red Rock will rely on distributions from Station Holdco to fund its capital requirements. In general, the Indenture
	governing the 7.50% Senior Notes and the Credit Facility limit distributions and other payments pursuant to a formula which permits distributions and payments to be made if they, together with any
	other "restricted payments," do not exceed 50% of cumulative net income since January&nbsp;1, 2013 (less 100% of all losses during such period), plus certain other amounts, including proceeds from
	the issuance of equity securities or equity contributions. Based on such formula as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 after giving effect to the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition and the Offering and
	Reorganization Transactions, Station&nbsp;LLC would have had the ability to make up to approximately $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million of distributions to its members. Any such distributions would be
	made to Station Holdco and would, in turn, be made by Station Holdco to its members on a pro-rata basis based on the percentage of their respective membership interests. The
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	86
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=95,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=338822,FOLIO='86',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]DE49601A.;67',USER='JFUSS',CD='14-MAR-2016;12:17' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DE49601_1_87">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	capital needs of Red Rock are expected to be substantially limited to required tax payments, legal and accounting expenses incurred in connection with its reporting obligations as a public company,
	compensation paid to its directors, its obligations under the tax receivable agreement and payment of dividends to its stockholders to the extent that such dividends are declared by the board of
	directors of Red Rock. As a result, we expect that the restrictions on distributions contained in the Indenture governing our 7.50% Senior Notes and our Credit Facility will not adversely impact the
	liquidity of Red Rock in the foreseeable future. However, there can be no assurance that such restrictions will not impact the liquidity of Red Rock in future periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Dividend Policy
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Following this Offering and subject to legally available funds, we intend to pay quarterly cash dividends to the holders of our
	Class&nbsp;A Common Stock initially equal to $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;per share of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, commencing with
	the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;quarter of 201&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;. The declaration, amount and
	payment of any future dividends on shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock will be at the sole discretion of our board of directors and we may reduce or discontinue entirely the payment of such
	dividends at any time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Red
	Rock Resorts, Inc. is a holding company and has no material assets other than its direct and indirect ownership of&nbsp;LLC Units in Station Holdco and its voting interest in
	Station&nbsp;LLC. We intend to cause Station Holdco to make distributions to us in an amount sufficient to cover cash dividends, if any, declared by us. If Station Holdco makes such distributions to
	us, the other holders of&nbsp;LLC Units will also be entitled to receive distributions pro rata in accordance with the percentages of their respective limited liability company interests.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	existing debt agreements of Station&nbsp;LLC, including those governing its credit facility and senior notes, contain restrictive covenants that limit its ability to make
	distributions. Because the only asset of Station Holdco is Station&nbsp;LLC, the limitations on such distributions will effectively limit the ability of Station Holdco to make distributions to Red
	Rock. In addition, any financing arrangements that we or any of our subsidiaries enter into in the future may contain similar restrictions. Furthermore, Station Holdco's ability to pay dividends may
	be limited by applicable provisions of Delaware law and subsidiaries of Station Holdco, including Station&nbsp;LLC and its subsidiaries, are generally subject to similar legal limitations on their
	ability to make distributions to their members or equityholders. See "Risk Factors&#151;Risks Related to Ownership of our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock and This Offering&#151;We may not
	have sufficient funds to pay dividends on our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock" and "Dividend Policy."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Capital Resources
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had $116.4&nbsp;million in cash and cash equivalents, which is primarily used for the day-to-day
	operations
	of our properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Revolving Credit Facility.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At December&nbsp;31, 2015, Station&nbsp;LLC's borrowing availability under its revolving credit facility was
	$296.8&nbsp;million, subject to continued compliance with the terms of the Credit Facility, which is net of $20.0 million in outstanding borrowings and $33.2 million in outstanding letters of credit
	and similar obligations. Subject to obtaining additional commitments under the Credit Facility, Station&nbsp;LLC has the ability to increase its borrowing capacity thereunder in an aggregate
	principal amount not to exceed the greater of (a)&nbsp;$350&nbsp;million and (b)&nbsp;an unlimited amount, if certain conditions are met and pro forma first lien leverage is less than or equal
	to 4.5x. Station&nbsp;LLC's ability to incur additional debt pursuant to such increased borrowing capacity is subject to compliance with the covenants in the Credit Facility and the indenture,
	including pro forma compliance with the financial covenants contained in the Credit Facility, and compliance with the covenants contained in the Credit Facility and the Indenture limiting the ability
	of Station&nbsp;LLC to incur additional indebtedness.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	87
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cash Flows from Operations
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our operating cash flows primarily consist of operating income generated by our properties (excluding depreciation and other non-cash
	charges), interest paid and changes in working capital accounts such as inventories, prepaid expenses, receivables and payables. The majority of our revenue is generated from our slot machine and
	table game play, which is conducted primarily
	on a cash basis. Our food and beverage, room and other revenues are also primarily cash-based. As a result, fluctuations in our revenues have a direct impact on our cash flow from operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, net cash provided by operating activities totaled $349.4&nbsp;million, compared to $269.8&nbsp;million for the prior year. The
	increase in net cash provided by operating activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the prior year is primarily due to improved operating results from our properties and
	our Native American managed properties as described under
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Results of Operations
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	above. Additionally, cash paid for interest decreased by
	$5.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the prior year as a result of the March 2014 repricing of our Term Loan Facility and a decrease in the principal amount
	outstanding on our debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, net cash provided by operating activities totaled $269.8&nbsp;million, compared to $250.7&nbsp;million for the prior year. The increase
	in net cash provided by operating activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the prior year was due to a $12.6&nbsp;million increase in management fees from Graton Resort,
	partially offset by an increase of $8.9&nbsp;million in cash paid for interest on our debt, as well as normal fluctuations in our working capital accounts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash flows from operating activities also reflect normal fluctuations in our working capital accounts. Operating cash flows for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013 included
	$24.5&nbsp;million and $20.5&nbsp;million, respectfully, of net cash outflows for discontinued operations. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, operating cash flows for discontinued
	operations were nominal.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cash Flows from Investing Activities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, we paid $129.9&nbsp;million, $102.7&nbsp;million and
	$86.7&nbsp;million, respectively, for capital expenditures, consisting primarily of various renovation projects at our properties, information technology equipment purchases and slot machine
	purchases. During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, we paid $1.8&nbsp;million, $2.6&nbsp;million and $3.6&nbsp;million, respectively, in reimbursable advances for the
	North Fork Project.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we received $26.3&nbsp;million in proceeds from asset sales, primarily from the sale of land previously held for development. During the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we received repayments totaling $66.0&nbsp;million on our advances for Graton Resort, which have now been repaid in full.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	88
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=97,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=466722,FOLIO='88',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]DE49601A.;67',USER='JFUSS',CD='14-MAR-2016;12:17' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DE49601_1_89">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cash Flows from Financing Activities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, Station LLC paid $84.1 million in principal payments on its indebtedness, and Fertitta
	Entertainment incurred $52.4 million in additional indebtedness, which was primarily used for an asset purchase. During the same period, we paid $211.2&nbsp;million in distributions to our members,
	and MPM and Fertitta Interactive paid $10.7&nbsp;million and $0.2&nbsp;million, respectively, in distributions to noncontrolling interest holders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we paid $74.3&nbsp;million in principal payments on our indebtedness and $153.3&nbsp;million in distributions to our members. For the
	same period, MPM paid $10.1&nbsp;million in distributions to noncontrolling interest holders and Fertitta Interactive received capital contributions of $10.0&nbsp;million from noncontrolling
	interest holders to fund its operations. In addition, we paid $2.5&nbsp;million in fees and costs related to Station&nbsp;LLC's March 2014 debt repricing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, we paid $69.2&nbsp;million in distributions to our members, and MPM paid $10.2&nbsp;million in distributions to noncontrolling
	interest holders. During 2013, Fertitta Interactive received capital contributions from noncontrolling interest holders totaling $15.3&nbsp;million. In addition, Station&nbsp;LLC paid
	$35.9&nbsp;million in fees and costs related to the refinancing of approximately $2.1&nbsp;billion of its outstanding indebtedness in March 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_30"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">

</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=98,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=208428,FOLIO='89',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]DE49601A.;67',USER='JFUSS',CD='14-MAR-2016;12:17' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DG49601_1_90">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Credit Facility
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On March&nbsp;1, 2013, Station&nbsp;LLC entered into a credit agreement (the "Credit Facility") with a $1.625&nbsp;billion term
	loan facility (the "Term Loan Facility") and a $350&nbsp;million revolving credit facility (the "Revolving Credit Facility"). The Term Loan Facility is fully drawn and will mature on March&nbsp;1,
	2020. In March&nbsp;2014, we completed a repricing of the Term Loan Facility. The interest rate under the amended Term Loan Facility is at our option, either LIBOR plus 3.25% or base rate plus
	2.25%, subject to a minimum LIBOR rate of 1.00%. We may, at our option, prepay the Term Loan Facility at par.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The interest rate under the Revolving Credit Facility is at our option, either LIBOR plus a margin of up to 3.50%, or base rate plus a margin of up to 2.50%, subject to a leverage-based
	grid. Additionally, we are subject to a fee of 0.50% per annum on the unused portion of the Revolving Credit Facility. Subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions, amounts may be borrowed under
	the Revolving Credit
	Facility, which shall be fully available at any time prior to maturity on March&nbsp;1, 2018. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, our borrowing availability under the Revolving Credit Facility was
	$296.8&nbsp;million, which is net of $20.0&nbsp;million in outstanding borrowings and $33.2&nbsp;million in outstanding letters of credit and similar obligations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject
	to obtaining additional commitments under the Credit Facility, we have the ability to increase our borrowing capacity thereunder in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed
	the greater of (a)&nbsp;$350&nbsp;million and (b)&nbsp;an unlimited amount, if certain conditions are met and pro forma first lien leverage is less than or equal to 4.5x. Our ability to incur
	additional debt pursuant to such increased borrowing capacity is subject to compliance with the covenants in the Credit Facility and the Indenture governing our 7.50% Senior Notes, including pro forma
	compliance with the financial covenants contained in the Credit Facility and compliance with covenants contained in the Credit Facility and Indenture limiting our ability to incur additional
	indebtedness.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All of our obligations under the Credit Facility are guaranteed by all of Station&nbsp;LLC's subsidiaries other than unrestricted subsidiaries. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, the
	unrestricted subsidiaries were NP&nbsp;Landco Holdco&nbsp;LLC ("Landco Holdco") and its subsidiaries, MPM and NP Restaurant Holdco&nbsp;LLC ("Restaurant Holdco"). The Credit Facility is secured
	by substantially all of our and our restricted subsidiaries' current and future personal property assets, and mortgages on the real property and improvements owned or leased by Station LLC and the
	restricted subsidiaries, and certain after-acquired real property based on thresholds. The Credit Facility is also secured by a pledge of all of Station&nbsp;LLC's equity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Credit Facility contains a number of customary covenants that, among other things and subject to certain exceptions, restrict our ability and the ability of our restricted
	subsidiaries to incur or guarantee additional debt; create liens on collateral; engage in mergers, consolidations or asset dispositions; make distributions; make investments, loans or advances; engage
	in certain transactions with affiliates or subsidiaries; engage in lines of business other than our core business and related businesses; or issue certain preferred units. The Credit Facility also
	requires that we maintain a maximum total leverage ratio ranging from 6.00 to 1.00 at December&nbsp;31, 2015 to 5.00 to 1.00 in 2017 and a minimum interest coverage ratio of 3.00 to 1.00, provided
	that a default of the financial ratio covenants shall only become an event of default under the Term Loan Facility if the lenders providing the Revolving Credit Facility take certain affirmative
	actions after the occurrence of a default of such financial ratio covenants. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, our total leverage ratio was 4.33 to 1.00 and our interest coverage ratio was 4.09 to 1.00,
	both as defined in the Credit Facility, and we believe we were in compliance with all applicable covenants. After giving pro forma effect to the Fertitta Entertainment Acquisition, including the
	payment of certain liabilities not included in the acquisition, and the Offering and Reorganization Transactions, at December&nbsp;31, 2015, our total leverage ratio would have been&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	to 1.00 and our interest coverage ratio would have been&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to 1.00.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	90
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=99,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=339486,FOLIO='90',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]DG49601A.;62',USER='ABEAULI',CD='14-MAR-2016;21:22' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DG49601_1_91">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are required to make quarterly principal payments of 0.25% of the original principal amount of the Term Loan Facility. We are also required to make prepayments on the Term Loan
	Facility with a portion of our excess cash flow as follows: (i)&nbsp;50% of excess cash flow so long as no default has occurred and its total leverage ratio is above 4.50 to 1.00 or a default has
	occurred and is continuing, (ii)&nbsp;25% of excess cash flow so long as no default has occurred and our total leverage ratio is less than or equal to 4.50 to 1.00, or (iii)&nbsp;0% of excess cash
	flow so long as no default has occurred and our total leverage ratio is less than or equal to 3.50 to 1.00. In addition, subject to certain customary carve-outs and reinvestment provisions, we are
	required to use all net cash proceeds of asset sales or other dispositions, all proceeds from the issuance or incurrence of additional debt, and all proceeds from the receipt of insurance and
	condemnation awards to make prepayments on the Term Loan Facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Credit Facility contains a number of customary events of default including, among other things, nonpayment of principal when due; nonpayment of interest, fees or other amounts after
	a five business day grace period; material inaccuracy of representations and warranties; violation of covenants (subject, in the case of certain covenants, to certain grace periods); cross-default;
	bankruptcy events; certain Employee Retirement Income Security Act events; material judgments; and a change of control. If any event of default occurs, the lenders under the Credit Facility would be
	entitled to take various actions, including accelerating amounts due thereunder and taking all actions permitted to be taken by a secured creditor.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	7.50% Senior Notes
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In March 2013, Station&nbsp;LLC issued $500&nbsp;million in aggregate principal amount of 7.50% Senior Notes due March&nbsp;1,
	2021, pursuant to an indenture among Station&nbsp;LLC, the guarantors party thereto and Wells Fargo Bank, National Association, as trustee (the "Indenture"). The 7.50% Senior Notes are guaranteed by
	all of Station&nbsp;LLC's subsidiaries other than unrestricted subsidiaries. The 7.50% Senior Notes are not guaranteed by Station Holdco, Station Voteco or Fertitta Entertainment. Interest is due
	March&nbsp;1 and September&nbsp;1 of each year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We may redeem all or a portion of the 7.50% Senior Notes at the redemption prices (expressed as percentages of the principal amount) set forth below plus accrued and unpaid interest and
	additional interest to the applicable redemption date:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_31"></A>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Indenture governing the 7.50% Senior Notes requires that Station&nbsp;LLC offer to purchase the 7.50% Senior Notes at a purchase price in cash equal to 101% of the aggregate
	principal amount outstanding plus accrued and unpaid interest thereon if the Station&nbsp;LLC experiences certain change of control events (as defined in the Indenture). The Indenture also requires
	that Station&nbsp;LLC make an offer to repurchase the 7.50% Senior Notes at a purchase price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the purchased notes if it has excess net proceeds (as defined in
	the Indenture) from certain asset sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Restructured Land Loan
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On June&nbsp;17, 2011, Station&nbsp;LLC's indirect wholly owned subsidiary, CV PropCo,&nbsp;LLC ("CV&nbsp;Propco"), as
	borrower, entered into an amended and restated credit agreement (the "Restructured Land Loan") with Deutsche Bank AG Cayman Islands Branch ("Deutsche Bank") and JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A. ("JPM") as
	initial lenders (the "Land Loan Lenders"), consisting of a
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	91
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=100,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=756461,FOLIO='91',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]DG49601A.;62',USER='ABEAULI',CD='14-MAR-2016;21:22' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DG49601_1_92">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	term loan facility with an initial principal amount of $105&nbsp;million. The initial maturity date of the Restructured Land Loan is June&nbsp;16, 2016. The interest rate on the Restructured Land
	Loan is, at CV Propco's option, either LIBOR plus 3.50%, or base rate plus 2.50% for the first five years. All interest on the Restructured Land Loan will be paid in kind for the first five years. CV
	Propco has two options to extend the maturity date for one additional year to be available subject to absence of default, payment of up to a 1.00% extension fee for each year, and a step-up in
	interest rate to not more than LIBOR plus 4.50% or base rate plus 3.50% in the sixth year, and not more than LIBOR plus 5.50% or base rate plus 4.50% in the seventh year. In addition, CV Propco is
	required to enter into an interest rate agreement that fixes or caps LIBOR at 5.00% during each of the extended maturity periods. Interest accruing in the sixth and seventh years shall be paid in
	cash. There are no scheduled minimum principal payments prior to final stated maturity, but the Restructured Land Loan is subject to mandatory prepayments with excess cash and, subject to certain
	exceptions, with casualty or
	condemnation proceeds. CV Propco has the intent and ability to execute the first one-year extension option which would extend the maturity date to June&nbsp;16, 2017, and accordingly, the amounts
	outstanding under the Restructured Land Loan were excluded from the current portion of long-term debt at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Restructured Land Loan contains a number of customary covenants that, among other things and subject to certain exceptions, restrict CV Propco's ability and the ability of its
	restricted subsidiaries to incur or guarantee additional debt; create liens on collateral; engage in activity that requires CV Propco to be licensed as a gaming company; engage in mergers,
	consolidations or asset dispositions; make distributions; make investments, loans or advances; engage in certain transactions with affiliates or subsidiaries; or make capital expenditures. We believe
	CV Propco was in compliance with all applicable covenants at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Restructured Land Loan contains a number of customary events of default (subject to grace periods and cure rights). If any event of default occurs, the lenders under the Restructured
	Land Loan would be entitled, in certain cases, to take various actions, including accelerating amounts due thereunder and taking all actions permitted to be taken by a secured creditor.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Restructured Land Loan is guaranteed by NP Tropicana&nbsp;LLC ("NP Tropicana," an indirect subsidiary of Station&nbsp;LLC), Landco Holdco (a subsidiary of Station&nbsp;LLC and
	parent of CV Propco and NP Tropicana) and all subsidiaries of CV Propco. The Restructured Land Loan is secured by a pledge of CV Propco and NP Tropicana equity and all tangible and intangible assets
	of NP Tropicana, Landco Holdco and CV Propco and its subsidiaries, principally consisting of land located on the southern end of Las Vegas Boulevard at Cactus Avenue and land surrounding Wild Wild
	West. The Restructured Land Loan is also secured by the leasehold interest in the land on which Wild Wild West is located. The land carry costs of CV Propco are supported by Station&nbsp;LLC under a
	limited support agreement and recourse guaranty (the "Limited Support Agreement"). Under the Limited Support Agreement, Station&nbsp;LLC guarantees the net operating costs of CV Propco and NP
	Tropicana. Such net operating costs include timely payment of all capital expenditures, taxes, insurance premiums, other land carry costs and any indebtedness payable by CV Propco (excluding debt
	service for the Restructured Land Loan), as well as rent, capital expenditures, taxes, management fees, franchise fees, maintenance, and other costs of operations and ownership payable by NP
	Tropicana. Under the Limited Support Agreement, Station&nbsp;LLC also guarantees certain recourse liabilities of CV Propco and NP Tropicana under the Restructured Land Loan, including, without
	limitation, payment and performance of the Restructured Land Loan in the event any of CV Propco, Landco Holdco or NP Tropicana files or acquiesces in the filing of a bankruptcy petition or similar
	legal proceeding. As part of the consideration for the Land Loan Lenders' agreement to enter into the Restructured Land Loan, CV&nbsp;Propco and NP Tropicana issued warrants to the Land Loan Lenders
	(or their designees) for up to 60% of the outstanding equity interests of each of CV&nbsp;Propco and NP Tropicana exercisable for a nominal exercise price commencing on the earlier of (i)&nbsp;the
	date that the Restructured Land Loan is
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	92
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=101,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=297186,FOLIO='92',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]DG49601A.;62',USER='ABEAULI',CD='14-MAR-2016;21:22' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DG49601_1_93">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	repaid,
	(ii)&nbsp;the date CV Propco sells any land to a third party, and (iii)&nbsp;the fifth anniversary of the Restructured Land Loan.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Other Long-term Debt
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other long-term debt includes the financing of our corporate office building, amounts outstanding under the Fertitta Entertainment
	credit facility, certain financed equipment purchases and other long-term obligations.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Corporate Office Lease
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We lease our corporate office building under a lease agreement that was entered into in 2007 pursuant to a sale-leaseback arrangement
	with a third-party real estate investment firm. The lease has an initial term of 20&nbsp;years with four additional five-year extension options. The lease also contains two options for us to
	repurchase the corporate office building, one option at the end of year five of the original lease term, which was not exercised, and another at the end of year ten of the original lease term. These
	options to repurchase the building constitute continuing involvement under the accounting guidance for sale-leaseback transactions involving real estate. As a result, the sale-leaseback transaction is
	accounted for as a financing transaction until the repurchase options expire. The lease payment in effect at December&nbsp;31, 2015 was $3.3&nbsp;million on an annualized basis, which will
	increase annually by the greater of 1.25% or the percentage increase in a cost of living factor, not to exceed 2%. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, the carrying amount of the corporate office building
	obligation was $33.9&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Fertitta Entertainment Debt
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On March&nbsp;26, 2015, Fertitta Entertainment amended its credit facility with Bank of America, N.A. and JP Morgan Chase Bank, N.A.
	(the "FE Credit Facility"). Under the
	amendment, Goldman Sachs Bank USA became a participating lender; the revolving credit facility increased to $55&nbsp;million and an incremental term loan of $3.0&nbsp;million was issued. The
	amendment lowered the FE Credit Facility's interest rate to either LIBOR plus a margin of up to 4.0% or base rate plus a margin of up to 3.0%, as selected by Fertitta Entertainment and subject to a
	leverage-based grid. In addition, the amendment extended the maturity date of the FE Credit Facility to December&nbsp;24, 2017. Prior to amendment, the interest rate under the FE Credit Facility was
	at Fertitta Entertainment's option, either LIBOR plus 4.50% or base rate plus 3.5%. Fertitta Entertainment is required to make quarterly principal payments of $750,000 on its term loan, which began on
	March&nbsp;31, 2014. The credit agreement governing the FE Credit Facility contains a number of customary covenants and events of default and the Company believes Fertitta Entertainment was in
	compliance with all applicable covenants at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In September 2015, a subsidiary of Fertitta Entertainment entered into a $22.0&nbsp;million secured promissory note and drew an additional $8.0&nbsp;million under Fertitta
	Entertainment's revolving credit facility to finance an asset purchase. The promissory note, which has a term of five years, bears interest at LIBOR plus 5.25% and contains a number of customary
	covenants and events of default. The promissory note is secured solely by the purchased asset.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At December&nbsp;31, 2015, $17.6&nbsp;million and $33.9&nbsp;million was outstanding under the FE Credit Facility's term loan and revolving credit facility, respectively, and
	$21.3&nbsp;million was outstanding on the $22.0&nbsp;million promissory note.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Derivative Instruments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We use interest rate swaps to manage our exposure to interest rate risk. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had one variable-to-fixed
	interest rate swap with a notional amount of $920&nbsp;million which matures in 2017 and effectively fixes the interest rate on $920&nbsp;million of our variable-rate debt to a fixed rate of
	5.02%. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, we paid a fixed interest rate of 1.77% and received a variable interest
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	93
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=102,EFW="2227620",CP="RED ROCK RESORTS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=1029061,FOLIO='93',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCM1.15ZCM49601]DG49601A.;62',USER='ABEAULI',CD='14-MAR-2016;21:22' -->
<A NAME="A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DG49601_1_94">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227620ZS-1A_HTM_BG49601A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	rate of 1.00% on our interest rate swap, which is the LIBOR floor stipulated in the agreements. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, interest rate swaps increased our interest expense by
	$8.5&nbsp;million. The changes in fair value of the effective portion of our designated interest rate swap are recognized in other comprehensive income, and the changes in fair value of any
	ineffective portion of our designated interest rate swap are recognized in change in fair value of derivative instruments as they occur.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior to March 2013, a portion of one of our interest rate swaps was not designated in a hedging relationship. Changes in its fair value were recorded to change in fair value of
	derivative instruments as they occurred. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, all of our interest rate swaps were designated as cash flow hedges. See Note&nbsp;11 to the Annual Combined
	Financial Statements for further information about our derivative and hedging activities and the related accounting.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Restrictive Covenants
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A description of the covenants included in the credit agreement governing Station&nbsp;LLC's Credit Facility and the Indenture is
	included in "
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	." We believe that as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, Station&nbsp;LLC was in compliance with the covenants
	contained in the Credit Facility and the Indenture.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have not entered into any transactions with special purpose entities nor do we have any derivative arrangements other than the
	previously discussed interest rate swap. We do not have any retained or contingent interest in assets transferred to an unconsolidated entity. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had outstanding letters
	of credit and similar obligations totaling $33.2&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
